00095 enum PathTraceDimension {
00096     PRNG_FILTER_U = 0,
00097     PRNG_FILTER_V = 1,
00098     PRNG_LENS_U = 2,
00099     PRNG_LENS_V = 3,
00100     PRNG_BASE_NUM = 4,
00101 
00102     PRNG_BSDF_U = 0,
00103     PRNG_BSDF_V = 1,
00104     PRNG_BSDF = 2,
00105     PRNG_LIGHT = 3,
00106     PRNG_LIGHT_U = 4,
00107     PRNG_LIGHT_V = 5,
00108     PRNG_LIGHT_F = 6,
00109     PRNG_TERMINATE = 7,
00110     PRNG_BOUNCE_NUM = 8
00111 };
00112 
00113 /* these flag values correspond exactly to OSL defaults, so be careful not to
00114  * change this, or if you do, set the "raytypes" shading system attribute with
00115  * your own new ray types and bitflag values.
00116  *
00117  * for ray visibility tests in BVH traversal, the upper 20 bits are used for
00118  * layer visibility tests. */
00119 
00120 enum PathRayFlag {
00121     PATH_RAY_CAMERA = 1,
00122     PATH_RAY_REFLECT = 2,
00123     PATH_RAY_TRANSMIT = 4,
00124     PATH_RAY_DIFFUSE = 8,
00125     PATH_RAY_GLOSSY = 16,
00126     PATH_RAY_SINGULAR = 32,
00127     PATH_RAY_TRANSPARENT = 64,
00128 
00129     PATH_RAY_SHADOW_OPAQUE = 128,
00130     PATH_RAY_SHADOW_TRANSPARENT = 256,
00131     PATH_RAY_SHADOW = (PATH_RAY_SHADOW_OPAQUE|PATH_RAY_SHADOW_TRANSPARENT),
00132 
00133     PATH_RAY_MIS_SKIP = 512,
00134 
00135     PATH_RAY_ALL = (1|2|4|8|16|32|64|128|256|512),
00136 
00137     PATH_RAY_LAYER_SHIFT = (32-20)
00138 };

00232 /* Shader Flag */
00233 
00234 typedef enum ShaderFlag {
00235     SHADER_SMOOTH_NORMAL = (1 << 31),
00236     SHADER_CAST_SHADOW = (1 << 30),
00237     SHADER_AREA_LIGHT = (1 << 29),
00238 
00239     SHADER_MASK = ~(SHADER_SMOOTH_NORMAL|SHADER_CAST_SHADOW|SHADER_AREA_LIGHT)
00240 } ShaderFlag;

00303 /* Closure data */
00304 
00305 #define MAX_CLOSURE 8
00306 
00307 typedef struct ShaderClosure {
00308     ClosureType type;
00309     float3 weight;
00310 
00311 #ifdef __MULTI_CLOSURE__
00312     float sample_weight;
00313 #endif
00314 
00315 #ifdef __OSL__
00316     void *prim;
00317 #else
00318     float data0;
00319     float data1;
00320 #endif
00321 
00322 } ShaderClosure;
00323 
00324 /* Shader Data
00325  *
00326  * Main shader state at a point on the surface or in a volume. All coordinates
00327  * are in world space. */
00328 
00329 enum ShaderDataFlag {
00330     /* runtime flags */
00331     SD_BACKFACING = 1,      /* backside of surface? */
00332     SD_EMISSION = 2,        /* have emissive closure? */
00333     SD_BSDF = 4,            /* have bsdf closure? */
00334     SD_BSDF_HAS_EVAL = 8,   /* have non-singular bsdf closure? */
00335     SD_BSDF_GLOSSY = 16,    /* have glossy bsdf */
00336     SD_HOLDOUT = 32,        /* have holdout closure? */
00337     SD_VOLUME = 64,         /* have volume closure? */
00338 
00339     /* shader flags */
00340     SD_SAMPLE_AS_LIGHT = 128,           /* direct light sample */
00341     SD_HAS_SURFACE_TRANSPARENT = 256,   /* has surface transparency */
00342     SD_HAS_VOLUME = 512,                /* has volume shader */
00343     SD_HOMOGENEOUS_VOLUME = 1024        /* has homogeneous volume */
00344 };
00345 
00346 typedef struct ShaderData {
00347     /* position */
00348     float3 P;
00349     /* smooth normal for shading */
00350     float3 N;
00351     /* true geometric normal */
00352     float3 Ng;
00353     /* view/incoming direction */
00354     float3 I;
00355     /* shader id */
00356     int shader; 
00357     /* booleans describing shader, see ShaderDataFlag */
00358     int flag;
00359 
00360     /* primitive id if there is one, ~0 otherwise */
00361     int prim;
00362     /* parametric coordinates
00363      * - barycentric weights for triangles */
00364     float u, v;
00365     /* object id if there is one, ~0 otherwise */
00366     int object;
00367 
00368 #ifdef __RAY_DIFFERENTIALS__
00369     /* differential of P. these are orthogonal to Ng, not N */
00370     differential3 dP;
00371     /* differential of I */
00372     differential3 dI;
00373     /* differential of u, v */
00374     differential du;
00375     differential dv;
00376 #endif
00377 #ifdef __DPDU__
00378     /* differential of P w.r.t. parametric coordinates. note that dPdu is
00379      * not readily suitable as a tangent for shading on triangles. */
00380     float3 dPdu, dPdv;
00381 #endif
00382 
00383 #ifdef __MULTI_CLOSURE__
00384     /* Closure data, we store a fixed array of closures */
00385     ShaderClosure closure[MAX_CLOSURE];
00386     int num_closure;
00387     float randb_closure;
00388 #else
00389     /* Closure data, with a single sampled closure for low memory usage */
00390     ShaderClosure closure;
00391 #endif
00392 
00393 #ifdef __OSL__
00394     /* OSL context */
00395     void *osl_ctx;
00396 #endif
00397 } ShaderData;
00398 
00399 /* Constrant Kernel Data
00400  *
00401  * These structs are passed from CPU to various devices, and the struct layout
00402  * must match exactly. Structs are padded to ensure 16 byte alignment, and we
00403  * do not use float3 because its size may not be the same on all devices. */
00404 
00405 typedef struct KernelCamera {
00406     /* type */
00407     int type;
00408     int pad1, pad2, pad3;
00409 
00410     /* matrices */
00411     Transform cameratoworld;
00412     Transform rastertocamera;
00413 
00414     /* differentials */
00415     float4 dx;
00416     float4 dy;
00417 
00418     /* depth of field */
00419     float aperturesize;
00420     float blades;
00421     float bladesrotation;
00422     float focaldistance;
00423 
00424     /* motion blur */
00425     float shutteropen;
00426     float shutterclose;
00427 
00428     /* clipping */
00429     float nearclip;
00430     float cliplength;
00431 
00432     /* more matrices */
00433     Transform screentoworld;
00434     Transform rastertoworld;
00435     Transform ndctoworld;
00436     Transform worldtoscreen;
00437     Transform worldtoraster;
00438     Transform worldtondc;
00439     Transform worldtocamera;
00440 } KernelCamera;
00441 
00442 typedef struct KernelFilm {
00443     float exposure;
00444     int pass_flag;
00445     int pass_stride;
00446     int use_light_pass;
00447 
00448     int pass_combined;
00449     int pass_depth;
00450     int pass_normal;
00451     int pass_pad;
00452 
00453     int pass_uv;
00454     int pass_object_id;
00455     int pass_material_id;
00456     int pass_diffuse_color;
00457 
00458     int pass_glossy_color;
00459     int pass_transmission_color;
00460     int pass_diffuse_indirect;
00461     int pass_glossy_indirect;
00462 
00463     int pass_transmission_indirect;
00464     int pass_diffuse_direct;
00465     int pass_glossy_direct;
00466     int pass_transmission_direct;
00467 
00468     int pass_emission;
00469     int pass_background;
00470     int pass_ao;
00471     int pass_shadow;
00472 } KernelFilm;
00473 
00474 typedef struct KernelBackground {
00475     /* only shader index */
00476     int shader;
00477     int transparent;
00478 
00479     /* ambient occlusion */
00480     float ao_factor;
00481     float ao_distance;
00482 } KernelBackground;
00483 
00484 typedef struct KernelSunSky {
00485     /* sun direction in spherical and cartesian */
00486     float theta, phi, pad3, pad4;
00487 
00488     /* perez function parameters */
00489     float zenith_Y, zenith_x, zenith_y, pad2;
00490     float perez_Y[5], perez_x[5], perez_y[5];
00491     float pad5;
00492 } KernelSunSky;
00493 
00494 typedef struct KernelIntegrator {
00495     /* emission */
00496     int use_direct_light;
00497     int use_ambient_occlusion;
00498     int num_distribution;
00499     int num_all_lights;
00500     float pdf_triangles;
00501     float pdf_lights;
00502     int pdf_background_res;
00503 
00504     /* bounces */
00505     int min_bounce;
00506     int max_bounce;
00507 
00508     int max_diffuse_bounce;
00509     int max_glossy_bounce;
00510     int max_transmission_bounce;
00511 
00512     /* transparent */
00513     int transparent_min_bounce;
00514     int transparent_max_bounce;
00515     int transparent_shadows;
00516 
00517     /* caustics */
00518     int no_caustics;
00519 
00520     /* seed */
00521     int seed;
00522 
00523     /* render layer */
00524     int layer_flag;
00525 
00526     /* clamp */
00527     float sample_clamp;
00528 
00529     /* padding */
00530     int pad;
00531 } KernelIntegrator;
00532 
00533 typedef struct KernelBVH {
00534     /* root node */
00535     int root;
00536     int attributes_map_stride;
00537     int pad1, pad2;
00538 } KernelBVH;

00540 typedef struct KernelData {

00546     KernelBVH bvh;
